summary: Better fx for wolves in Skyrim.
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=#EBE1E0]
[img]http://orig00.deviantart.net/1782/f/2016/011/0/4/wolfaudioheader_by_versispellis-d9nk57z.png[/img]

[img]http://orig14.deviantart.net/e9f2/f/2016/009/8/5/about_by_versispellis-d9nahnv.png[/img]

The mod that no one honestly asked for, but I really wanted to do!
The audio bites for Skyrim's wolves were adequate, but there was
room for improvement.  Using the pre-existing vanilla audio bites,
one public domain growling track, and clever audio mixing in Audacity,
I've given the wolves of Skyrim a fresh new voice.  

[b][u]This mod:[/u][/b]
- Makes wolves breathe silently.
- Replaces cartoonish barking sounds with snarls.
- Adds new, bassy aggrowarning growls.
- Adds more aggressive power attack sounds.
- Replaces jarring, unpleasant death and injury sounds.
- Varies pitch and tone, so wolves don't sound monotonous.
- Adds a 1/4th chance to hear a wolf choir in the distance! 
- Contains no scripts, and is safe to uninstall any time.

[b][u]This mod doesn't: [/u][/b]
- Replace sounds for the sake of it.
- Add campy, stock wolf howl sound effects.
- Replace footfall noises.  I saw no need to reinvent the wheel.  
If you want better footstep sounds, see [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50109/?][color=#9C9CC9]Immersive Sounds: Footsteps[/color][/url]. 


[img]http://orig15.deviantart.net/f293/f/2016/009/f/c/cred_by_versispellis-d9nahnu.png[/img]

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6h2Q-s24x7U][color=#9C9CC9]Wolf Growling Sound Effect[/color][/url] by Iwan 'qubodup' Gabovitch
licensed under Creative Commons

If you're downloading True Wolves of Skyrim, don't forget to check the downloads
page for fantastic patches and extras, including skins for Garm and Lola, a
wonderful standalone dog follower.

[/color][/center]
author: Versispellis
